data.title: Yearly & Monthly weather
data.meta_description: Kabul, Afghanistan - Climate and weather forecast by month. Detailed climate information with charts - average monthly weather with temperature, pressure, humidity, precipitation, wind, daylight, sunshine, visibility, and UV index data. On the contrary, the initial winter months from December to February bring freezing temperatures dropping from 8°C (46.4°F) to a severe low of -7°C (19.4°F), coupled with short daylight durations of less than 11 hours, not recommended for travel. This city's unique peculiarity unfolds as it endures almost no rainfall from June to September, even during the high daylight hours when temperatures are most potent.
data.text:
Average temperature

Kabul, Afghanistan

The warmest month (with the highest average high temperature) is July (32°C).

The month with the lowest average high temperature is January (4°C).

The month with the highest average low temperature is July (16°C).

The coldest month (with the lowest average low temperature) is January (-7°C).

Average daylight / Average sunshine

Kabul, Afghanistan

The month with the longest days is June (Average daylight: 14h and 24min).

The month with the shortest days is December (Average daylight: 9h and 54min).

The months with the most sunshine are June, July and August (Average sunshine: 11h).

The months with the least sunshine are January, February, March and December (Average sunshine: 6h).
